Reviews.Title: “Two opposing views”
Reviews.Author: colm1
Reviews.Content: From what I can determine, both from my own experience and from talking to a friend who has also stayed at Hyde Park Towers, there is a big difference in the standard of the rooms that are offered. My friend advises that his room, was quite acceptable and pretty much in line with the photos etc on the hotel's website. I wasn't so lucky. My room was on the ground floor and was the most disgraceful room you could wish for. . . best described as a rat hole. So, if you choose to stay here, you'd best hope for one of the better rooms or you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyalble short stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveK93
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and was a bit apprehensive due to mixed reviews. But was pleasantly surprised by the welcome we received and friendly, positive attitude of the staff throughout our short stay. The hotel was being refurbished and we we one of the last customers before closure for a few months to finish this off. The public areas are very good and welcoming. The bedroom was a bit small, but fine for us, as we only wanted to sleep there, not hang around during the day. Beds were comfortable, with very clean and fresh bed linen. Superb location, just a couple of hundred yards from Bayswater tube, with Queensway tube not much further away.

Reviews.Title: “short visit to london”
Reviews.Author: yvettealbertse
Reviews.Content: booked a twin room and upon our arrival received extremely small double room, this was soon sorted and chnged to our original request. twin bed, tv, bath with shower, thick white towels, helpful and friendly personel

Reviews.Title: “Ignore other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Josephine G
Reviews.Content: This was only a one night stay as a treat from my daughter for my 65th birthday. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit concerned but there was no need. It was close to a lot of attractions and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The comfiest beds and goose down duvets and pillow that I have ever slept in. The hotel is under going renovation so the lift wasn't working but that was my only gripe. Fulll English Breakfast which was included was wonderful. It set us up for the day. The waiter even brought my Grandson a cup of hot chocolate without even asking. There was plenty to eat. Staff were wonderful and well mannered. If I wanted 5 Star I would have paid 5 Star so the people who drag it down should book 5 Star and pay 5Star prices. You get what you pay for. Would certaily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: chris r
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally misrepresented by the web site and Capital Breaks who we booked with . The whole place smells strongly of damp , the carpets are stained and threadbare .The room we given had awful black mould on the walls , rotten windows , light fitting hanging off the wall and the wash basin was cracked . The carpet was filthy. We did not stay . This place should be closed down immediately.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump!”
Reviews.Author: EMK123
Reviews.Content: This place is horrendous to put it mildly, filthy dirty, shabby. Our room was freezing in the basement, the bathroom with boarded up windows, it stank of stale sweat, cigarettes, had not been vacuumed. The floors ceilings were dfilthy with stains, mould and the carpets torn, stained as was the chair. The wiring was beyond belief. A tiny 14" Beko TV hardly working. I cannot believe this place is allowed to put guests up - it is a health hazard and should be shut down. The sink was filthy, the toilet, the shower was cold the shower curtain coming apoart and down from the ceiling. Wiring for the towel rail running through bedroom over bathroom door through big clumsy drilled hole into bathroom!! You wouldn't dare put your bare foot on the floors - it ruined our New Year trip to London - and the staff think the place is wonderful and cannot see there are any issues!! Unbelievable! If there had been a fire in the corridor we could not have got out as the bedroom window was stuck and had a filthy curtain half hanging at it - with Russian workmen outside the window. coming in and out of some room or other! Drainpipes leaning up against the windows! All I can say is its a nightmare and please avoid it at all costs. AWFUL PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: juicy10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for New Years Eve as a Christmas present for my girlfriend and was embarrassed by the state it was in. Half the front of the building is covered in scaffold and noise from the construction could be heard throughout the hotel. The carpets are worn,windows are single glazed with a rotting frame,room was tiny (Room 203),you could not open the wardrobe fully as the bed was in the way),lift was broken (btw the stairs are small and cramped with not enough room for two people to pass),wifi was only available in lobby. The radiators didnt work but instead there was a shabby plug in heater...I could go on forever! On our first night we asked the receptionist to order us a taxi to Mayfair (2 miles) -she rang a taxi and told us it would be Â£18. We declined and instead flagged one outside the hotel and cost us Â£6:50!!! While the location is good the transport systems in London are excellent so regardless of where your staying all the sites can be easily accessed by tube or train. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: STA123
Reviews.Content: This was simple horrible. The room was part of a theatre/hotel deal. The small room was dirty and there was a sick-stain on the greasy carpet. There was mould in the bathrom with a brown stains around the chipped bath. The walls were three tone - old cream, newish cream and dirty! No heating except for electric heaters and a very old TV that only had two blurred channels. The hotel was being rebuilt - there may be hope......

Reviews.Title: “We didn't even stay more than one hour!!!! Long enough to book another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fishy1972
Reviews.Content: Absolutely appalling! We arrived, entrance and reception area clean, got taken to our room via the ripped carpets on the stairs and hallway, starting to look shabby at this point. Got into room that was freezing cold, radiators. It working there was plug in heater in room, on full, still cold! Room was horrid, cigarette burns, stains all over carpet, then we dared check out the 'en suite' which was challenge in itself of getting into it because of the positioning of the door. Still ice cold in there - no heating. TV didn't work, bedding smelt of damp, bathroom had lots of mould. This was birthday trip and we had no intention of staying there once we'd arrived. We stayed long enough to book a travelodge :-) and we left and didn't look back. It was shocking! Oh and I forgot it stank of cigarettes even though they had 'no smoking' signs everywhere! We left before we caught something nasty or our 4yr old did. Definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone. The only funny thing was the staff appeared so surprised when I said their hotel was a dive, their faces were a picture!

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever ! A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Elie A
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for 3 night because the room was prepaid and they refused to refund it. The carpet of the first room I got was so dirty , I was disgusted to step on it with my shoes ! I had to change room 3 times before finding one that was livable. No central heating but electrical radiators ( I had to ask for two in my room !). The shower was acceptable and the bathroom in general was ok, considering the rest of the facilities. The TV had about 4 channels. The elevator went to the 1st floor only and you would get to your room (I was on the 3rd floor) through a maze of stairs with dirty carpets. The service was very good and everybody was extremely helpfull. The location of the hotel is excellent . Please avoid at all costs !

Reviews.Title: “Was like a nightmare, never stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lara l
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, they gave us a room in the lower ground which was completely smelling toilet & humid. The room was very small and even you can not put your luggages into that room. The walls & carpet were black due to dirtiness, and I have never stayed such horrible place in my life. Bath was very small and dirty, I would rather stay unwashed instead of having a shower there. Also, there is a constuction going on inside/outside the building and do not come here if you would like to rest a bit. There is no relevancy between the pictures on the web and if you do not have strong anger management, never stay at Hyde Park Towers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lucky we were only there one night!”
Reviews.Author: NicBobLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked a show and hotel deal for my birthday (Wizard of Oz is fantastic by the way!) The hotel looks brilliant on the website and we were looking forward to a lovely weekend. As all the other reviews say, the staff were lovely and really helpful but room 203 is in no stretch of the imagination, a double! It is a broom cupboard and is in desparate need of modernising. The hotel is covered in scaffolding, so perhaps they will get round to doing simple maintenance in the bedrooms. Could be a brilliant hotel, shame the rooms let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: sarahorbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for my Birthday to see a show and London. It was under modernisation at the time which didn't really affect us.Close to Bayswater tube station. Good selection of restaurants nearby. Bed was so comfy !!!!!! Breakfast was delicious. Look forward to returning if we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Id rather have stayed in prison!”
Reviews.Author: Richiebaby1987
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two colleagues as we were on a course in London. Hotel looked quite nice on pictures however it was a completely different story when we got to our room which we called 'the dungeon' Checked in and the hotel looked ok and the staff were very nice. They said our room was on the lower ground floor, which seemed like the cellar. Got into our room and smell nearly made my nose fall off, a smell I can only describe as mould. The paintwork was a horrendous tobacco yellow and lights not working properly, bathrooms was hideously rancid and mould and dirt everywhere, floors stained all over. My bed was fairly comfortable although one of my colleagues had a bed where she could feel every spring. The hotel was going through renovation but they should not allow customers to stay in these dungeon rooms. The foreign construction workers were waking us up at all hours through the night slamming doors and running around shouting! Oh and the fire alarm woke us up around 7am! If the hotel offered me Â£100,000 to stay in that room again I would decline.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: chl2208
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was ,going to be nice but it wasn't . The room we had had stains all over the carpet , dirty water , little stones coming out the shower and the toilet wasn't clean! It is in the middle of no where and to get to most attractions its about a 4 mile walk ! The full english was 2 sausages 1 bacon 1 tomato and 1 mushroom for Â£10 ! The staff we always arguing as we could hear them from our room . This was a dreadfully stay and they will not expect to see us back !

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Ana M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyde Park Towers Hotel. Staff was very friendly, it was clean, not luxuous, but perfect for us. The location was absolutely magnificent, just a 100 mts from Bayswater tube and 300 mts from Kensigton Gardens and Hyde Park. If I go back to London soon I will for sure stay there. Its a wonderful relation between quality and price.!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: newyorktraveler_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an easy walk to the Baywater tube stop and close to Notting Hill. But it is basically a dump. Card keys don't work more often than they do. Hot water one day, nothing the next. No air conditioning. Worn carpets. Rusty, ill-repaired bathrooms with scratchy, small towels. Tiny drab rooms. The smallest TV I have ever seen. It featured all of 8 channels. The staff was pleasant and helpful and it was inexpensive. But it hardly made up for the how depressing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip and was travelling by myself. When I arrived I was rudely greeted and abruptly sent up to a room on the first floor. I had a sense of foreboding as I walked along the dirty worn corridor. When I unlocked the door to my room I found it was a dirty, dingy and not much bigger than a cupboard. It had torn curtains, stained carpets, was dirty and it smelt. Directly outside the window was a large noisy industrial unit sending out vibrations that made the windows buzz. It was clear you could never get any sleep in the room. There were not even any pillows on the bed. I asked for another room and they moved me to one further along the hallway that was a little bigger but still very small and cramped. This too had stains on the floor, ripped curtains, paint peeling on the walls, mould in the bathroom, was dirty and smelt of damp. The only saving grace is that it was a little further away from the noisy units at the rear of the hotel. I was informed though that is was one of their best rooms!! By this point I was tired and it was too late to find another hotel so I gave in and had to accept the room. That night I tired to make a cup of tea. The kettle blew up (smoke and sparks) electrocuting me when I tried to turn it on. They then tested/set off the fire alarms repeatedly at 11.30pm. On and off until they had made sure they had got everyone in the building up. No apology was made for this to any of the guests. Finally through the droning of the industrial units to the rear of the hotel I managed to get to sleep. I was up early the next morning and so was everyone else in the hotel as workmen were hammering and banging around the corridors from around 7am. I had to get up but I am not sure the poor people on their holidays would have appreciated it. When I came back up from breakfast, which was nothing spectacular and certainly does not live up to the promises on their website, I found my room key no longer worked. I had to go up and down to reception 4 times before I could get back into my room. This was the final straw and I asked to speak to a manager to complain. The staff and the purported manager could not care less about the complaint so I gave up. To add insult they then tried to charge me Â£12 per night higher than the published rate for the room I had stayed in when I came to pay. The place is an absolute dump and I felt incredibly sorry for the holiday makers staying there who all looked completely miserable. It was simply a horrible place to stay and you could do much better in London for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “tired and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cassieBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We had been treated to a Red letter experience which included tickets to a show in the West End and a overnight stay at this hotel. Having read some of the reviews I decided to book an extra night in order to make this a weekend to remember. On arrival reception was clean and staff were very polite and helpful.. However once we got off the lift it was clear that this was not reflective throughout. The carpets were worn and threadbare. The room, despite being a double was small. The decoration and furnishings appeared tired. The net curtains were dirty and the bedding did not fit properly. This was probably due to two single mattresses being zipped together. The bathroom was very small and cramped. The first morning breakfast was a full English which was plentiful and enjoyable. We were informed that following morning a continental breakfast would be served. We did not question this on the presumption that there was either a lack of staff or it was because it was Sunday. it soon became apparent that this was not the case as we could see that some people were still being served a full English breakfast. When we questioned this at reception we were told that a full English breakfast carried an extra cost of Â£5.00 and the second night of our stay was not inclusive of this service. This did not sit comfortably given that non residents could come from outside and access this service at the same cost. The hotel is as described centrally located and only a very short walk from Hyde Park and Notting Hill. However having paid in excess of Â£100 for one night bed and breakfast we felt disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeYorks_England
Reviews.Content: After reading previous comments on Trip Advisor not expecting much, however pleasantly surprised on arrival. Clean and not lacking in the usual amenaties, great location for central location, near to Bayswater tube station and Hyde Park, breakfast choices very good and plentiful. Comfortable bar area available at reasonable prices. Staff friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park Towers or Faulty Towers?!”
Reviews.Author: musical5melody
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a double room and were surprised to find 2 single beds when we arrived. My partner queried this with the boy on reception and he asked how many beds we had and then could we not just push the beds together?! My bemused partner tried to explain that this wasn't the point, as we had booked a double room but it was clear he wasn't going to get anywhere so decided to leave it until the following morning. If this wasn't bad enough, I went through to our toilet and discovered faeces on our toilet seat! I couldn't believe my eyes. As it was late and there didn't appear to be a Manager on duty, we decided to speak with the Manager the next morning. When we spoke with the Manager the following morning, she didn't seem to care at all!!! Regarding the bed, she said that they had to have the room set out that way for maintenance before we checked in and that she could offer us another smaller room or zip our beds together. When I raised the cleanliness of the toilet and showed her the photo, she didn't even bat an eyelid and said she would raise it with the cleaners. No offer of compensation or apology. I would never stay at this hotel again. I think that the lack of respect or consideration for the poor state of our room were appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews suggest!!”
Reviews.Author: msp80510
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights (Fri & Sat) in July. I had read previous reviews and was slightly concerned by the negative comments. What I can say is the hotel is nowhere near as bad as some people are suggesting. Yes the rooms are small and the paintwork is a little shabby, but overall the hotel offers excellent value for money - for a start the rooms have individual bathrooms (which is hard to find in central London for this price) If you are looking for somewhere to sleep with easy access to tubes/London sights,this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but a bit like a labyrinth”
Reviews.Author: Madbert
Reviews.Content: The staff was very, very nice and we did like the hotel and their food in general. There was a maintenance problem with our double bed room the first night so we had to settle with two single bed rooms in the other ends of the house, which was a bit of a drag, but at least we did get some free breakfast as a complementary. The location is very good since it's only a few steps away from Kensington Gardens and the nearest tube station. Would definitely go again. Oh, and it was Jimi Hendrix' first home in London!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sarajahe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location and decent prices. The staff is helpful and rooms are clean enough. Worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: Keithtruax
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying in this hotel. The location was ideal to get around and see the sights. All of the reviews that I was able to read said that the main problem was that the rooms were small. I live in NYC so I was not worried about a smaller hotel room. Plus I was a single traveler so I did not see a problem. The first night was fine, the bed was a old and not very comfortable but it was doable. I was woken up at 8am by someone knocking on my door, now keep in mind I was still on NYC time. They then told me that they needed me to change rooms because they need to started construction on the whole floor that I was staying on. Well I was not pleased but I figured don't raise a fuss your on vacation. So the second room they put me in was not special but it was a much better bed to sleep on. The next morning I was again woken up at 8 am butbthis time it was the construction workers above me doing demo work on the room directly above me. I was not thrilled yet again but it forced me to get up early and go and see the sights. Everything was ok until on the 4th day while I was in the shower the work was still going on above me, I came out of the shower to find the there was a pipe leaking on my bed. At this point I was getting very annoyed with this hotel, they moved me into my 3rd room. This room was the worst of all, not only was the bed very uncomfortable, the wifi did not work in my room. So to do any emails or Skype I had to walk to the front lobby. This was not ideal any way you look at it. You would think that at this point after 3 rooms and all if the problems that I had made the front desk aware of that someone from the management team would check in on me and see if everything was fine. Not one word!! All I have is an email of their cotsumer sevice rep. I will never be staying with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An 80th Birthday treat completely spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: Jan6636
Reviews.Content: I booked a theatre break for my two sisters and myself to see the Lion King followed by a night at this hotel. The show was wonderful. We got back from the matinee to check in before going out to dinner. I had emailed the hotel the previous Saturday to say it was a special treat for my eldest sister's 80th and could we please have the best triple available. I rang again the day before our trip and was told that I would not be disappointed in the room'. What a shock! The room was tiny! It had a double bed jammed against the bathroom wall with a single bed underneath the window 4 feet away. With only 2 feet at the end of the bed. The carpet was threadbare, the window wouldn't shut, the curtains were filthy, the tiny bathroom had a cracked basin and weeks of dust on the skirting boards. There is no way three adults could have shared this room. I complained and was told that the hotel was full and they had no other room to offer us. I would not let it rest and eventually the duty manager came to see us and offered another single room for one of us to use. He was very apologetic and said he could understand why I was so disappointed. That was the best they could do and we had to make the best of it. Unfortunately, I had already paid in advance via Capitol Breaks. I have now written a Formal Complaint to the director of the hotel and await his response.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably shabby”
Reviews.Author: AdeSouth
Reviews.Content: Atrocious, just atrocious. I was moved here from a hotel close by because they had 'computer system issues'. Carpets are threadbare. Walls were paper thin. Floors creaked badly. The place has a bad damp smell. The staff I had dealing with did not understand English fully, I could go on. Book at your peril....

Reviews.Title: “Great area, close to underground and Paddington train station”
Reviews.Author: Noskis12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice, both times for business. I chose it for its location (I needed to be close to Paddington) and wifi in the room. It was very clean, but somewhat shabby. They definitely need a renovation. The breakfast choice is quite limited, but was okay for me. I did find it a bit too expensive for what I got. The reception staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: davekarenBournemouth
Reviews.Content: this place needs knocking down and starting again stayed 2 nights first night put in basement (dungeon) aka staff quarters not hot water tube noise every couple of miutes rained all night and downpipe broken so sounded like you where sleeping? next to a shower . staff retuned in the early hours singing smoking and shouting (and i thought smoking in puplic places was illegal) attempted to speake to manager who really wasnt botherd we complained to staff after checking in and they said they could not move us till the next night but to be honest nobody really cared as they had already debited the money from my card room we where moved to not much better on the second night but at least we had hot water. avoid this so called hotel stay at travel inn as much better lol

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff but shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connect52
Reviews.Content: We checked in early last week at the Hyde Park Towers Hotel. Hotel is located in a convenient location, shame hotel is sadly aged, needs lots of touching up but excellent staff and extremely friendly staff in reception too and all around. Staff are a credit to the management and certainly help to hold ship tight. We arrived at the hotel but rooms were not ready and while waiting for the room we decided to go for lunch in the hotel restaurant. Duty manager greeted us politely and seated us in the restaurant and took our food order and served us with great professionalism. I must say his manners and service was marvelous, considering he is serving customers drinks in the bar and staff keep coming to him and while doing all these things happening around him he stays calm and never missed a point in customer care approach and he made sure we were correctly looked after. Oops forget to mention, food served was excellent presentation and walnut bread and olive oil went very with your good food. I would like to recommend your duty manager to Fernando Peire, Director of Ivy restaurant, who does the ''TV Restaurant Inspector'' on Channel 5. I am sure the duty manager would be able to give a lesson or two in the TV show. Finally, the hotel is in a good location and in need of a complete refurbishment. The majority of the good staff compensate for the shabbiness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Bev-MP
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel, badly needs a good cleaning and upgrade, filthy carpets and very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Might stay again...At a push.”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Squeak
Reviews.Content: One night stay on a theatre trip with my wife. Within very easy reach of two tube stations (Bayswater & Queensway) Hotel stuff were pleasant and helpful. Room was â€˜okâ€™ but like so many others reviewers have already mentioned the room did look tired and in need of modernisingâ€¦..And those floor boards creaking so much I found myself tip-toeing around as it must have been driving the people below crazy. I would go for the continental breakfast as the English one we had added in our price was below standard. Just didnâ€™t feel, or look fresh, or indeed, cooked properly. Overall this hotel is just below average at best. I might stay here again, but only at a push.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: AWalks
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay in a nutshell; slow check in, tiny room, dirty windows, smelly towels, sticky carpets, poor ventilation. Wont be heading back.....ever

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: alinvicen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated close to Hyde Park and within a walking distance to the most central parts of London. I spent 3 nights here at the end of spring 2010, with nice weather most of the time and Hyde Park looking more beautiful than ever. Our first room was located below ground level and kind of hard to find. The biggest problem, though, was that every time the metro/subway went by underneath us our entire room shook. Apart from this making it hard to sleep it was also a very scary feeling and we switched rooms as soon as we could the morning after. Our second room was located on level 2, and had a window facing the street outside. This was a whole lot better, and although the room was small for two people (in separate beds) we had all the space we needed for our relatively short trip. The room was also very clean, which made up for its small size and minimal bathroom. If weÂ´d gotten this room from the start I wouldnâ€™t have much bad to say actually, the hotel was situated in a lovely little area which was relatively calm for being so close to central London. We also found some great restaurants nearby. Sadly, I never really managed to shake the thoughts of those subway tunnels underneath. Not exactly a calming feeling. Other than that the hotel staff was nice as well as helpful, especially when helping us switch rooms. They were also well organized during breakfast time in the morning (the breakfast was fine, but could also have been better for a hotel with three stars).

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: amazing_mable
Reviews.Content: A friend and me had booked a couple of days in London to see a show & do some shopping. Having read the reviews of this hotel we were rather nervous about staying here! We founf the staff were friendly & helpful. The charming concierge arranged discounted tickets for some of the attractions. The hotel couldn't be more conveniently placed within very easy walking distance of 2 tube stations - I mean VERY easy walking distance. The down-side of this is that you can hear the rumbling of the tubes from when they start running at about 6am until they stop at midnight. The room needed a re-fit & a darn-good clean. The window frames were rotting, a knob was missing on a drawer, the carpet was stained, the paint in the bathroom was peeling & dirt had built up in the less easy areas to reach - behind the TV, in the corners of the room etc. However, the bed was clean & very comfortable & the shower powerful & hot - just don't look up at the dirty shower head! Breakfast was good - a good selection of cold meats, hams, fruit & pastries for the continental option & a well cooked traditional English breakfast. You have to go into the lounge adjoining the restaurant to make your own toast which isn't convenient. You also have to serve yourself to cups of tea/coffee &, since I have to drink a vast quantity of tea before I wake up in the morning, I'd have preferred to have a pot on my table - maybe if I'd thought to ask they could have let me have one. I'm going to London again next year & I think I'll try to find somewhere else to stay though.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: elmersmiths
Reviews.Content: over priced, room 123 shook when tube went underneath which was often no proper window so no view headboard was next to shutter doors in corridor felt like wall was coming down everytime someone went through them. felt dirty, bed base all stained was glad to leave asked to be moved was told no rooms till next day was only a one night stay and if it wasnt would have moved hotels anyway carpets threadbear shower room unclean but staff friendly and helpfull all communal areas and reception looked good shame about rest in definate need of a redecor and refurb

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, the worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: RodLightning
Reviews.Content: This comes from a well travelled person who has rolled with every eventuality that comes with world travel to remote locations, but this is London, next to Hyde Park. Normally we opt for The Hyde Park International owned by Shaftsbury hotels, it is directly opposite. Their rooms are beautiful and the same price Â£120 per night. So two nights to be in London as we were both sitting exams that we'd studied two years for. The staff were really nice and helpful, cannot fault them. The hotel is old, the main gripe is the creaking floorboards that keep the entire hotel awake as people move around and slam doors throughout the night. We asked to be moved to top floor, it was no problem, we were added to the list of customers who had to be moved. Now we had peace and quiet but the hotel is so shabby and run down, it needs a Â£1,000,000 to get up to scratch. See my picture of a bathroom, if you are over 5 feet and 1lb overweight then you've had it. The bed were comfy, I'll give them that.

Reviews.Title: “clueless”
Reviews.Author: Neil_from_Birmingham
Reviews.Content: I won't go into the details of the rooms as many reviewers have (very accurately) already done so. What i will comemnt on is the restaurant/customer service. We foolishly decided to eat in one night, a decision that surprises me almost as much as it surprised the waitress in the restaurant who's facial expression confirmed that customers were the absolute last thing she expected to see that night (we were the only customers there.) "oh yeah" was the response when we said we were there to eat. At which point we were handed menus (hastily snatched from a nearby table and displaying only about 6 items to choose from) then came an awkward pause. After a few seconds of standing in the aisle clutching the menus the waitresses training kicked in and she offered to seat us "ummmmmmmm somewhere round here" Ok, not the best starts but we'll press on. After about 5 mins the waitress re-appears to take a drinks order, I order a drink but my wife doesn't (it's happy hour by the way, buy one get one free, this wasn't pointed out to us) a couple of mins later the waitress comes back with my drink and takes our order. my wifes first choice - not in stock my wifes second choice - not in stock my wifes third choice - yay, result! my first choice - not in stock my second choice - yay, result!......They really didn't expect customers did they, not only do they have a pityful selection but half of that isn't even in stock. My wife had a Rocket salad which, whilst it looked half wilted, she enjoyed. I had a foccacia club sandwich (can't go wrong there i'd said to myself.) Now traditionally a club sandwich is Turkey (or chicken) bacon, lettuce and tomato..............I ended up with a ham and cheese sandwich between 2 slabs of cardboard like foccaia bread. Ok, time to leave................where's the waitress? do you know? i didn't! Oh there she is! I think to myself as she peeks around the corner with that same (blimey customers, what do i do now?) expression. Much to her relief we'd given up on food and left. Breakfast was an altogether different affair, there were customers! Same waitress again, and again looking shocked at these people milling around and forcing her to work. Seated after about 5 mins, no offer of tea/coffee (even though there were other waiters doing so for their tables,) no offer of anything else for that matter, in fact we didn't see a single staff member again until we gladly checked out. If you do go here, please don't use the restaurant, everyone will be happier for your decision.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: oslo75
Reviews.Content: .... and what you get is a dump. cramped rooms stained carpets dirty walls dirty sheets (no joke) dirty bathroom (I won't even describe it). The price isn't even that cheap. We stayed in their "Executive Suite". An executive of what, I have no idea. The area -- lame. Bayswater is essentially Lebanese food, kiosks, mobile phone stores and cheap commercial merchandise. This is one of those places that is a perfect example of false advertising. The pictures look nice. But when you arrive, you quickly realize you made a very big mistake. The owners should be drawn and quartered for allowing this place to operate in such disrepair. The only positive note I can write is that the bar is open 24 hours (the night clerk/watchman will get you a beer or make you a drink upon your request). And trust me, if you stay here, you'll need to be drunk. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Shame about the room everyone please read”
Reviews.Author: marksanderson45
Reviews.Content: I booked online nice and easy, Got there with my wife and while checking in a little dark hair girl was behind the reception witch was very rude and didn't want to tell me anything, one thing i say about her hygiene and a lot more customer services. The hotel was Very well located in central London nearby an underground station. Very nice lobby area which doesn't reflect what the rooms look like though. I had a room on the lower ground floor. Very narrow staircase to get down there (not very easy when you carry luggage). Very old carpet. Very small room with a very small bathroom. Noisy room (I could hear the underground), and no internet signal in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely the WORST hotel in which I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: reginaNy
Reviews.Content: I was the group leader for a school tour to Paris and England. We were booked into the Hyde Park Towers Hotel for 3 nights (4/16-4/18, 2011). Upon arrival, we found that the room configuration did not match what we had been booked for and so had to spend nearly 45 minutes reconfiguring our group. When we arrived at our rooms we found that they were horribly dirty and not in good repair. For example in my room, the carpeting was badly stained and frayed. The bathroom had hair on the floor and in the tub.The wood surrounding the vent in the bathroom had been eaten away by moisture and the tub was full of mold. The tissue box holder in the bathroom was loose and falling away from the wall. Only 1 out of 2 plugs worked. The TV did not work, and the room was tiny, even for UK standards. Unfortunately, because of the group and the fact that it would not be easy to find rooms at a late hour and date (London Marathon Weekend) we were forced to stay. We only hope that we didn't bring critters home with us. Many of our rooms were in the dungeon under the stairs ala Harry Potter. The underground is very close and we felt each and every train. There was poor air circulation in the rooms, even with the open windows. I am glad we had to spend no more than a total of 26 hrs there since we were out and about touring.

Reviews.Title: “backpacker's hotel”
Reviews.Author: munchkin021
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as part of a gift package. We were glad it was only one night! Never like a hotel that has the need to lock it's front door so that you have to ring to get in. The staff are pleasant enough but english is obviously not a first language for any one we had contact with. The hotel smelt quite stale and all the carpets were dirty and stained. Wouldn't walk on the bedroom carpet in bare feet. The room was small with the bed mainly filling it. The bathroom was in need of redecoration although reasonably clean. The room had a broken window and again needed redecorating totally and cleaning to a higher standard. Breakfast was ok but like a noisy school room with no charm. This is a place for packpackers to stay one or two nights when they are out most of the time! Not a place for Londoners to stay for a night in town.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay well clear of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacGalway
Reviews.Content: On check in receptionist were very rude, Mix up with our rooms and we did not get as much as an apology from them. The room we got was just awful. I would not even call it a hotel room. The room was tiny. 2 single beds in the room and there was no room for your suitcases. To get changed you had to stand in-between the 2 single beds for room to move. You could open the door while still sitting on the bed. The bathroom was a joke. You could actually sit on the toilet and wash your hands in the sink at the same time. Our kettle in our room was broken. You could hear every time the tube passed as it would rattle the whole room. Paid Â£80 a night which was a complete rip off. I would never stay here again. On our second night here one of our other rooms were told they had to move rooms as the hotel over booked and needed there room back. All staff were so rude. After a night out in London we were left waiting a half hour outside the hotel door before anybody opened the door. On check out we were not even asked how your stay was. Only for its location this hotel would not be in business

Reviews.Title: “no matter what..”
Reviews.Author: BartRusli
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. It was right next to the train station..so in an excellent location, The area is also safe to walk around and there are plenty of halal restaurants,cafes, shopping mall, souvenir shop around it. The room was clean and neat, and although not hugely spacious, it was very good value for money in our opinion. In all all, highly recommended and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor room”
Reviews.Author: UrbanGlobe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Hyde Park and two tube stations, what is excellent. Notting Hill neighbourhood is in walking distance. However, the small room was located below ground and when we were looking out of the windouw we faced gray concrete instead of blue sky. Furthermore the room was not clean at all. It looked like the space behind the radiator has never ever been cleaned so far. You also could hear the subway below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “won't be going back will give a miss”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny45
Reviews.Content: on arrival all looks ok , rooms very small all need freshnin g up paint wise and refurbishing carpets are all worn in the hallways and stairs , a very tired looking hotel they received a award for best hotel in 2007 and it looks like the carpet has not been replaced since . the beds were comfortable bedding clean and white , breakfast the next morning was continental help yourselves , no saucers for cups hot water for tea in a jug on a hot plate that looked like a bit of milton sterilising fluid would help there was no where to put the used teabag and paper when i asked i was told to just put it in another cup and she would clear the rubbish the trays the cupos were on needed a tray cloth or new trays it would not take much to improve standards here no will cross this hotel off our list the reason for staying in this area was for a closer proximity to a resaturant that was about 9 mins away in a taxi

Reviews.Title: “Worst then i expected”
Reviews.Author: berdemli
Reviews.Content: Room was small and it wasn't giving any feeling that it was clean and the stuff looked so bored. I wouldn't mind if i hadn't payed too much money. It doesn't worth to stay if you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Dilapidated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StoaGroningen
Reviews.Content: Ah! Such a very good and dedicated staff: efficient, friendly, welcoming. But a totally dilapidated hotel (and certainly no towers but it looks pleasant enough from the outside): worn down, threadbare carpets in the hallways and on the stairs; blotchy-spotty carpet in the room. Crickety elevator; creaking floors throughout. The room was one of the tiniest I've ever had. The (single) bed was very narrow and rather too short; but the matrass was comfortable. This room at the back of the hotel was extremely noisy: some sort of engine/motor was running constantly except for the time between midnight and 6.30 AM. Moreover, the other guests - large student groups from the continent - were boisterous and noisy and of course trampled the creaking floors. I slept hardly a wink in three nights. But the bathroom, small as it is, was spic-and-span clean; but I don't like those 'general' dispensers with soap and shampoo: no knowing what a prankster might have put in them... Breakfast is 'continental' and at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NL33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is standard compared to other London hotels. Small rooms, small bathroom, but nice and clean to a fairly good price. Breakfast is not included but it is nice and with a lot of things in the buffet. You can get English breakfast as well. But the most important thing is, that it is really well located quite close to the Bayswater Underground. You can actually hear the trains under the hotel. Not a big problem since the underground closes at midnight. Nice and friendly staff - and they've got happy hour in the bar from 4-7 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Hyde! More Like Hide!”
Reviews.Author: jackadvisor1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a night in the hyde park towers hotel for her birthday. Checked the website out for the pictures etc, place looked more like a 4 star! That was until we got there! The room was below ground level with a window view of a wall about a metre from the window (felt like we'd been burried under ground) a ladder, a drill and broken bits of glass and metal, basically a mini building site. The room had a damp caravan smell that made u gag, shower was ice cold and the room was about a third of the size of the one in the pics on their website! Everything was basic, if you've been camping with the scouts then you'd consider this a downgrade, reminded me of the room used in the final scene of the film 'trainspotting' Unfinished cheap diy lookin wallpaper, carpet and other bits an bobs. Satelite tv consisted of about 10 scrambled channels of which about 5 of them being the same channel and the other 5 being foreign. Officially ripped off, cost me Â£71 but worth about a tenner.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: technical54
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, reception and bar area appear nice, but upon entering our room on the 2nd. floor we were met with badly stained carpets, grubby net curtaining hanging at the badly fitting, draughty window, and wardrobe doors hanging off their bottom hinges. The bathroom comprising shower, wash basin and toilet was crammed into a small area giving just enough room to be practicable. Our view from the window was depressing, looking out over roofs at the back of the hotel, littered with discarded cigarette ends. The continental breakfast was basic, and note that eggs are not included you have to pay extra for this luxury !!! In our opinion, this is not a 3 star hotel, but if you are looking for basic accomodation without any frills and close to London's attractions this is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: raffobeer
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this hotel! They gave me an horrible rooms placed in the basements of the hotel with a little windows. In the room there was a lot of dust and the bathroom didn't work correctly. During the afternoon a receptionist entered in our room without knocking! They haven't even changed my room becouse they had not other rooms available! It was really expensive 295,00 GBP for 2 nights in a horrible double room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: mindinconflict
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and small, but still great! Only 3-4 minutes walk from Bayswater underground or 6-7 minutes walk from Queensway Underground connects you to both the circle line, district line and central line which is three of the most important lines to get around in London. The single room was small but okay. The bed was great and I slept very good at night. I see that people has complained about bad internet and mobile reception. I did not have this problem at all with the right service providers (I lived in room 306). WiFi worked great with a speed up to 11Mbit downstream and 1Mbit upstream. WiFi hotspot is connected to a router that supports VPN pass-through for those who need that. Orange and O2 has a bad mobile reception, but T-Mobile and Vodafone worked great. The staff offers a high level of service and they can help with almost everything. I enjoyed my stay so much, that I changed my flight home and stayed one night extra. Will stay here again the next time I go to London.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel must be owned by miserable People”
Reviews.Author: Moorehall
Reviews.Content: Dirty hotel. Reception well managed,nice people(Denise is really efficient) to get the business . Mean owners who want to screw the clients. Really filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Tired looking & noisy, but great location and fab staff”
Reviews.Author: swanzchick16
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for one night, and although it wasn't the the Ritz, it wasn't that bad. The room was very tired looking, as was most of the hotel, and could have done with a lick of paint, but the most important thing was that the hotel and room was clean. Staff were fab, weren't supposed to check-in until 3pm but they got us in early. The rooms are BOILING at night times, and if you open a window the noise from outside disrupts you, so wear thin layers. Great location, 2 minute walk to tube station. The walls are very thin, and you can hear people above you, below you and side to side. The ceiling also sounded like it was going to cave in at any moment. The room was adequate size, but we were only staying for one night, so that didn't really bother us. Recommended for a short stay, because it is very reasonably priced. Breakfast great too!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Flocke212
Reviews.Content: This Hotel seemed to be very good at frist. The website was quite good and the lobby looked great. As we went to our room we felt like in a maze. We had to go through different corridors, some of them were outside. The only window in our room was at this outside corridor and so we had to keep the curtains closed because people were constantly walking by. The beds were uncomfortable, the room, even for London, super tiny. The bathroom was dusty and dirty and you couldn't even turn around in it because it was so small. The walls were extremly thin and we could here the toilet flushing from the rooms above us. The only good aspect is the location as it is a minute away from the next tube station.

Reviews.Title: “A little above average in a GREAT area”
Reviews.Author: pontificator
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not great but it is a good value in a great location. We stayed here for a few days in Dec 2010 and were generally happy. The double room on the second floor was fairly large for London with a rare excellent high powered shower. The room was tired but functional and had a french door to a small balcony. Breakfast was nothing special. The location is my favourite in London within a short walk to tons of shopping, restaurants and 3 tube stations - not to mention Portabello Market in Notting Hill that's not to be missed. Decent place for under $100/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, hidden VAT”
Reviews.Author: jameswilliams681
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. On check-in an unexpected VAT charge was added to our internet price. Our room was small and the bathroom cramped. Although our room was clean it seemed the hotel needed a general refurbishment. It was very near a tube and in a good central location. No air con.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Pontificator2
Reviews.Content: Unusual in a value hotel in London our room had some great attributes, a king size bed with nice linen and some room to maneuver, a shower/bath with a powerful spray, french doors to a good size balcony, good security and solid wifi. However the hotel hallways and room was shabby and while i'm nit picking the heat was hard to control (radiator) and there was a flood light pointed at the room. However, the location is my favorite budget choice in London and the room was a very good value (70 Pounds). Staff were nice and included breakfast decent. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but very acceptable hotel for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: politicsandrew
Reviews.Content: Yes the furninshings are a little tired and the rooms bit pokey but if you are on your own and you want a place in central London where you can get a good night's sleep, a hot bath and do some work the next morning this hotel is absolutely fine. They have free WIFI which every hotel should offer these days and the hotel is in a quiet street so there isn't much noise. For some reason or other they won't let you pay in advance for your breakfast and you are expected to pay in the dining room the next morning which caught me out and when I asked the staff to let me pay on check out they got quite stroppy. But apart from that.......

Reviews.Title: “This hotel doesn't keep their promises”
Reviews.Author: Mikaela9
Reviews.Content: We happened to reserve a room from here in April 2010. The same day that the volcano erupted in Iceland. So, we couldn't travel to London at all OR make a cancellation in time, because how were we to know that we couldn't travel that day? The hotel promised to refund the hole amount, 300 + euros they already charged in January, which was weird and early anyway. The haven't refunded a cent, not even when Mastercard contacted them. So, we lost 300 euros and didn't stay there a minute. This hotel sucks so bad...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Plaidguy2010
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We were assigned room 55. The room was extremely tiny with old furnishings. There was no place to put the suitcases aside from one small closet (which only fit one suitcase). The bathroom was so small that you could literally sit on the john and have your face in the sink at the same time. Toweling yourself off after a shower without hitting a wall or fixture was all but impossible. We had no wi-fi reception in the room and my wife had to take our laptop to the bar in order to access the internet. The absolute worst part, though, was finding evidence of bedbugs! Granted I did not actually see the bugs themselves, but the mattress was literally covered with all sorts of little dark spots that result from either bedbug excrement or from the blood popping out when people roll over and squash them. I immediately asked the desk clerk for another room, and his reply was simply "No bedbugs here!" I showed him the evidence and he agreed to move us to a room on the third floor. Same size, same condition, but no evidence of bedbugs in that room. The next morning, we were abruptly awakened by a fire alarm at 6 AM that thankfully didn't require us to evacuate. We couldn't check out soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Think Of Staying In THIS Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mathewG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a DUMP if I have to compare what I paid for a Family Room (Very Small) in this Hotel versus a basic Hotel like the Premier Inn Group of Hotels it is a Ripp Off!!! Family room was a double bed pussed against the wall with a single bed nearly against the bottom of the double bed. Lift was always out of order, rooms is very small and the ensuite even smaller, view of a brick wall when I drew the certains. Room was cleaned only after 15:00pm the afternoon and when I complained to the "Manager" it was because of the amount of people booking out (Wonder WHY!!!) and they had to get the rooms cleaned up Hotel supposed to have had a major revamp but a coat of paint will not fix the toilet hanging from the wall!!! I made the mistake of booking in this hotel on a "No Cancellation basis" and I was stupid to do this as I would have cleared out of there the moment I walked into the room. Don't even think about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap Rates--Very Ordinary Hotel on a Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: Mkblev
Reviews.Content: The street on which the hotel is located (Inverness Terrace) also includes a number of other downmarket hotels and hostels where student-aged people congregate on the steps and pavement, which makes for a noisy evening if your room overlooks the street. However, this location is extremely convenient to cheap shops, supermarkets and restaurants on Queensway one block away, and it is convenient to several tube stations and the neighborhoods of Notting Hill and Paddington. Our room (an "executive" twin) was clean but in need of renovation, and it was very cramped. With the exception of the TV which never worked quite right, everything else was tolerable for a short stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “A very disturbed nights sleep in a very basic and overpriced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cathed207
Reviews.Content: The Hyde Park Towers is in a fantastic location - close to 3 tube lines, and with all the amenities you could wish for within a stones throw. The hotel itself is tired but clean. The staff are not the most helpful I have ever come across but pleasant. On checking in, we had a lot of trouble as the reservations team had not forwarded my reservation through to the team on the front desk. After much to-ing and fro-ing by the receptionist, the problem was eventually resolved but a check in that should have lasted 5 minutes lasted almost 20 and the girl was not apologetic in the least. We had a small twin room on the 3rd floor which was clean and adequate as a place to crash for the night. However, at 3am we were woken by a fire alarm. At 8:30am we were again awoken - this time by the maid knocking at our door. After saying 'there's someone in here!' the maid entered the room, didn't say anything and then slammed the door. I was pretty annoyed by this. At 10am I was heading outside to get some fresh air and whilst waiting for the lift, the maid approached me and asked if she could clean our room. I told her we were still in the room and there wasn't much point. She told me I needed to check out now and I told her I didn't - and showed her documentation to prove that check out was at 12pm. She then left me alone but went along every door on the floor, knocking and entering. An adequate place to crash after a night on the town, but no good for people wishing to spend any length of time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated, Cramped, Rundown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IMAMAC
Reviews.Content: Close to a tube station is the only positive thing I can say. My wife and I spent 7 miserable nights in a hotel that catered to no one and had rooms that were better suited to a third world country. Staff were friendly as long as you didn,t have a problem. Breakfast was tolerable but evening meal was just plain bad. Rooms were intolerably small and cramped. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: commercial4levi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my mum. 2nd floor room with nice view. Rooms basic but comfortable and cleaned well daily. Bathroom small but very good hot water and powerful shower!. Excellent customer service from all members of staff...particularly the ladies on reception who were very helpful with all queries! Fantastic location, near tube stops and plenty of places to eat/ drink just one street over. Can be quite noisy in the mornings with laundry trucks etc pulling up but quality of sleep still quite good thanks to super comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “To far from west end”
Reviews.Author: chrissylob
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip for my Grandson and my Daughter for his birthday i know we only paid Â£103 per person for it but was upset that we were so far from the west end.The room was on the ground floor and when i pulled back the curtain it was a few feet from a brick wall and no light coming in.The room was clean the breakfast was ok but what we spent on TAXIS we could have stayed in a 5 Star hotel still we live and learn.I will book next time on my own not with a company we also had a ticket for the lion king that was great and it was inclusive of that price.The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fair location but very dirty & tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: moorcroft29
Reviews.Content: Rooms allocated were nothing like those advertised on the website. We booked a twin room for 2 days & initially given 2 single rooms on 2nd floor. Rooms were at end of corridor and down about 10 stairs & isolated, not good for 2 elderly ladies. Returned to reception & were given a twin basement room, down loads of stairs, which smelt of smoke & bleach. We were then given 2 singles on ground floor that were tiny & windows didn't open & very hot weather .Finally a miniscule twin room on 3rd floor with a dirty shower & the doors hanging off. Only redeeming feature was the linen was clean. Hotel near tube stations.

Reviews.Title: “A single room with a double bed!”
Reviews.Author: RobbotheBrit
Reviews.Content: We were a couple staying with friends (3 other couples) on an overnight stay booked 3 weeks in advance as part of a weekend theatre trip. Our matinee performance meant that we could not check in to our room until late at night after dropping of our luggage earlier and when we got to the room we discovered that it was in fact a 5`6" wide single room with a 4`6" bed on the ground floor with the window just a few feet from the pavement outside. We immediately complained to the receptionist who declared the hotel fully booked and could not help us as he was only the night porter. I requested to speak to the night manager who was "unavailable" until 07: 30 the next morning so I vented my disgust but alas was unable to get any further. (I was later told by the "duty manager" at 08:00 that this night porter was in fact the night manager i.e. I was lied to.) Having no ventilation meant leaving the lower sash window next to the bed open to prevent us stifling in the heat that night. This led to very little sleep due to the noise from the road and passing revellers. The bathroom was a shower room with very little room to dry off comfortably and had mildew in many areas with no effective window or ventilation (The pavement facing window had hardboard covering the glass.) Given that we paid Â£124 for this so called double room (no. 62) I felt that we had been shabbily treated and would not recommend this hotel to anyone as good value or customer friendly. Two of the three other couples in our party suffered the same problem of a double bed in a single room and were similarly disgusted. The breakfast was OK but we had to wait for a place to sit as the dining area was inadequate for the size of the hotel. I will also be contacting the booking agent (travelstay.com) as they should be aware that this hotels` squeeze `em in policy also reflects on their future business. Do Not be passed off with room 62 at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hotel is a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: CDNTravler_10
Reviews.Content: Hyde Park Towers Great location, two tube stations located close and within walking distance of Oxfort St. and Buckingham Palace. Local restaurants average except for fantastic Greek Restaurant in lane behind hotel Started with room G19 the basement, no air circulation, windows sealed, mould smell and a carpet that should have been replaced years ago. More stains (animal most likely) on carpet then one could count. Moved to 2nd floor, front of building. Again no air circulation, poor quality beds, dirty, bathroom, smells of urine and bleach, carpet worn. Had to leave bathroom door open when occupied or you would vomit from smell. . Pedestrian and traffic noise unbelievable, Youth hostel across street, main thoroughfare with 24 hour traffic. Beds are sub standard in any country, air mattress would have better support. The sheets were clean. Breakfast, as basic as you can get with some fresh fruit, but not always offered. Watered down juices. Staff basic, no professionalism. Overall, good location, hotel sub standard and I would not recommend this to anyone as your holiday will be ruined. The positive reviews of this site are more than likely entered by the hotel staff, as with all honesty this is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: anniePortTalbot
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in July. Staff were very friendly and eager to please, especially the bar/restaurant staff. Had a room on the 2nd floor facing the main road. The beds were lovely and comfortable and had 4 excellent nights sleep, with little noise. In an excellent location, with 2 tube stations in the next street. Bar prices were high but we took advantage of the happy hour and had 2 bottles for the price of one. Food was average, had a tomato soup starter, Lasagne and a bottle of beer for Â£10 and plenty of complimentary bread. Would stay again.Rooms were cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, rooms awful!”
Reviews.Author: netolin7
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, itÂ´s pity they donÂ´t stop offering those miniscule rooms to their guests. Two persons with any luggage at all would be hard pressed to stay comfortably in a standard room. Badly in need of renovation in general. A bit more training in customer service for their breakfast room staff would not go amiss. The old nugget that youÂ´re only in your room to sleep doesnÂ´t really cut it, the room IS part of your trip and should be comfortable and pleasure to return to after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “great location with nice price, noise problem both front and rear”
Reviews.Author: casadeta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near two underground stations, lots of various restaurants(next street), and the great Hyde Park(end of street). The front door was a hassle all the time, it opened outward and the automative sensor didn't work well. The front desk people's training are not quiet in place. The first night we were staying in a third floor (top most floor) room in the front, facing the street. The traffic noise from the street was not very bad, but there was the high-pitch humming noise. I called to ask the front desk about this noise, the guy even answered, "I don't know, I'm just here for two weeks." Was that an excuse for any customer? I asked him if someone else would know, then came Zia, who was extremely helpful. He explained that noise was from the Hotel's own exhaust fan for all bathrooms on the roof, and offered to turned it off for me for the night. In the early morning, the street-cleaning car's noise was quite something. For these two kinds of noise, and the lack of A/C (top floor got sun heat more directly), the next 3 days we switched to a second floor room at the rear of the builidng. The rear didn't have the nice view of nice white English terrace houses, and still have the noise from the ground floor and neighborhood restaurants' A/C units. We though these noise were more endurable than the front ones, but after all, we realized this was not going to be a quite hotel at all. The first room's mattress was too old and too soft that it sunk so much. The second room's was fine. The rooms were considerably clean. For some reason, our laptop wasn't able to connect to the freee Wi-Fi, so we wouldn't this part of servie they claimed. For 95 pounds with continental breakfast in London, we recommanded this a valuable choice, but because for urban travelling, we valued quietness a lot, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amber1943
Reviews.Content: Avoid basement rooms. which could be noisy from the undeground trains. Very welcoming with friendly and helpful staff. Our room was small but we only slept in it. Spotlessly clean sheets and towels but a little "tired looking" decorations and blinds. We had an excellent evening meal here on our first night which was 2 courses and a glass of wine for Â£10. You are given Â£2 drinks' vouchers for orders over Â£10. This is easy to achieve at Hotel drink's prices.. Handy for Bayswater or Queenswy tube and lots of shops around to buy lunch and eat in the Park. Breakfast is self service but cooked breakfast can be ordered. Lots of different breads, meat, cheese, cereal and fruit. Rooms tucked around corners with steps, but one near the lift could be asked for on booking,should that be a problem. Our single friend booked a twin at very little extra rather than getting a very small single room.

Reviews.Title: “You do not get value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tilmaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges a premium for the location, which is actually quite spectacular and upmarket. It is located at a stone's throw from Queensway and Bayswater tube (Underground) stations, and barely a couple of minutes walk from Bayswater Road (adjoining the magnificent Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park). The Bayswater Road leads straight to Marble Arch and Oxford Street. The location is ideal for tourists. However, the hotel per se is average to below par. The rooms are small, carpets are visibly dog eared, the bathroom is not well maintained, the thermostat in the bath does not work (one gets singed in hot water) and the toilet seats are broken. Complaints have not yielded results. The hotel is full of European tourists, who obviously do not know where to go, but no British tourists seem to be around, which goes to show that the British know where to get value for money. The breakfast, however, is good. No complaints there, and the standard of service, during breakfast, is not bad. There are many similar hotels around, and I would advise prospective tourists to do a bit of shopping around before deciding on anything.

Reviews.Title: “It fitted my needs and I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: blondie_scorpio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights back in June 2010 and I was satisfied with my room. Good points: central and good location (really close to 2 subway stations and I could sleep at night even if I had a room at the lower ground floor, so there's not so much noise because of the subways); plenty of supermarkets, restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops around; quiet street - the one the hotel is situated on; there are smoking allowed rooms (apart from this, you can smoke in the hotel garden as well - it had really taken me some while to find a hotel where smoking is permitted!) Bad points: there are issues with the cell signal in the room and hotel (you may lose it completely). But I admit that I noticed this on the streets as well, from time to time... not sure what the cause of this is... it may be due to my ISP... This was my main inconvenient during my stay in London, as I kind of depended on my cell, so I often needed to get out of the room to make a phone call or send a SMS or so... Also, the rooms are small, that's true, but this was not a problem for me, as I didn't really stay inside. Overall: price - quality: I would stay again at this hotel, as it's a good deal for London (at least the room rate I got).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, tiny and damp rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ten_Forward
Reviews.Content: We (my mum and me) stayed in a very tiny (narrow) room in the basement and it was noisy and damp. The tube station is very close so that you could hear the trains from your room (while trying to sleep) . Breakfast was a disappointment but luckily there were a Starbucks just around the corner. The location was excellent and staff were nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it !!!”
Reviews.Author: MP18Illinois
Reviews.Content: Even if the hotel was not full, they gave me a tiny room in the basement. I asked to be changed. I was given another room at first floor, tinier than the previous one, and smelly (urine or anything else, i don't want to know). At the end of my stay, they didn't give the bill because the server was "down", and they promised they would send it by e-mail. Of course, they didn't, and even didn't answer to the email I sent. The personal at the reception is rude and not helpful. So if you don't want to be mistreated, run away from this place !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Michlyn7
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel. If you want luxury you are going to pay for it. This is a great hotel for people in town to sight see. We loved the location and the staff was very helpful. The rooms are small, but clean. It was loud the first night due to a very large family taking up over half of the hotel. We simply asked the front desk for a quietier room and they had us moved within 30 minutes. I went with mom, friend and sister over spring break and we had no regrets about the hotel. It was very close to 2 tube stations as well as McDonalds, Burger King and Pizza Hut if you need a taste of home. You can walk around the neighborhood by clicking street view on google maps. I found this helpful and made me more comfortable seeing the surrounding areas. Let me say one more time. This is not a fancy hotel. It is clean, in a great location and great for people who only sleep in their rooms. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mossop10
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hyde Park Towers, it is a good budget hotel in a great location. The staff are freindly nad are happy to help with any request. The continental breakfast has a good selection. The room was clean and big enough for two of us, the bathroom was tiny but I know thats what you tend to get in this style of hotel in london, shower worked well and thats what counts. Room and bathroom did look a little tired, flakey paint in the bathroom and a few stains on the carpet, also the pillows on the bed were way too spoft for my liking but thats personal preference. Overall not a bad little hotal which i would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunbird121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HPTH for a total of seven nights in May 2010. I was alone for the first three nights and with friends the other four,but had my own room the entire time. My stay was broken up into 5 nights (went to paris for a night) and then 2 nights in a separate room. The hotel is about a five minute cab ride from Paddington Station,at a cost of 8-10 pounds for the cab ride. My single room cost me 70 pound/nt (my friends twin room was 85 pounds). Its a nice enough looking hotel on a quiet street,and the lobby looks as nice as a lobby in your basic Choice Hotel/Holiday Inn/Hampton Inn chains. There is a 24 hour reception desk so it was quite safe for a single female. My inital room(May 10-14) was pretty small,resembled an inside cabin on a cruise ship.It had a twin bed,3 drawer dresser/desk and a closet.The bathroom was small but had a tub/shower combo.It was prety tight but I didn't spend too much time in it,just the last hour or two before I went to bed and getting ready in the morning,so it was good enough for the price.That particular room location( I think it was room 207) was pretty quiet,I didnt hear any of the Tube noses that I had read about before on the forums. It was pretty out of the way though,but it was nice b/c it felt secure and private. The bed was surpisingly comfortable for a twin.My only complaint about the room would be that is was a bit chilly-I had the heater cranked up the entire time to maintain a room temp like atmosphere.The water pressure in the bathroom was great and there was plenty of hot water. My room for the final two nights was a bit better in terms of space (room 128) It had steps leading down to the room so the floorplan seemed more open and spacious than the first room had. However,on these two nights I COULD hear the Tube running,and it did get a little distracting. As for the hotel's bar/restaurant/breakfast...ehhh...can't say I'm a fan.Breakfast was a bunch of raw meat,some fruit and yogurt,and croissants with coffee/juice. I only ate there twice(it was included in the price of my room),and only had a quick croissant and jam.I didn't linger. The hostess never attempted to seat me with anyone,although there weren't that many tables,I found a seat by myself for the few minutes I was in there. the "bar" was actually a room off the lobby with a few armchairs and a TV,and a little bar off to the side. It wasn't always staffed,but if you asked the receptionist they would come over and serve you something. It was technically open 24 hours though,as I found out... As for the restaurant,it was Italian based and they did provide room service up to 1030pm,but the selection was pretty limited.Unless you were desperate for a meal and could not walk for a second,I would walk the 1/2 block to Queensway for a meal. Location-as I said,if you walk out the front foors,make a right,walk about three feet,make another right,walk another three feet,you are at Quuensway Blvd.On this street,the Bayswater Tube station is within eyesight of the corner that you approach it on.The Queensway tube is at the end of the street on the left,by the entrance to the Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park,but due to the zillions of stairs I'd try to use Bayswater as much as possible. In either direction on Queensway there are souvenir shops,internet cafes,restaurants(I recommend the waffle house for breakfast,going towards Queensway Tube),American fast food chains(pretty much all of them!),Barclays Bank(partner of Bank of America,so withdrawals are free for BOA customers) money exchange places,pubs,and a casino.The restaurants seem to stay open pretty late. As I said,Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park are a 5 minute walk away,and the two tube lines from Bayswater take you pretty much anywhere else.It was a superb location,unless you HAVE to be right in the midst of Covent Garden,but I dont think its worth the added price myself. My only legitimate complaint about the hotel would e the night receptionist. On our second to last night,he was chatting with one of my friends in the bar,and he claimed to be a palm reader. He "read her palm" and told her some stuff that made her pretty upset,which,looking back,was probably just him hitting on her. Very unprofessional. I wouldn't advise hanging out in the bar because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: Kangarookate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 2 nights only - thank goodness. Rooms were very shabby and basic, carpets and upholstery very stained. Bathrooms very small and need painting. Also old window frames needed to be replaced with double glazing as the road outside is very busy even at 3 am. Floorboards creeked like you were on the Marie Celeste. Overall 2 out of 10, because of the location. Also no air conditioning . I would not stay there again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic loaction, but completely unorganised”
Reviews.Author: blades-fans
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's only a hundred yards or so from Bayswater Tube Station and less than five minutes walk from Queensway tube too, so it's very easy to get to/from. It's within very easy reach of loads of eating places, which are open late, so you'll never be left looking about for somewhere to eat. It's also only a few minutes walk from Kensington Gardens. The hotel itself is a bit 'tired' looking. Our room (a twin) which I shared with my 11 year old son, was small, the bathroom even smaller, with barely enough space to dry yourself after a shower. The blind in the bathroom looked a bit mouldy and the whole place could have done with a lick of paint. The carpets were threadbare, and as others on here have said, the floorboards are incredibly squeaky. The hotel is far from quiet, as it sounds like the tube line runs underneath it, every few minutes there's an almightly rumbling noise.
